name: No.
description:
Crisium Grid and Off the Grid combo makes running a remote an expensive proposition – once set up, the runner will need to get into HQ twice before they can run your remote, plus spend 5 to trash Crisium Grid.

Lots of money and ETRs, with a couple program trashing ICE. Power Shutdowns to get pesky programs off the table. Punitive Counterstrike for when you get an agenda or two snagged from you early (which can happen).

Crisium Grid is pretty powerful. Here are a list of things it's saved me from so far: • Account Syphon (installed on HQ) • Sneakdoor Beta (installed on Archives) • Hades Shard (installed on Archives) • Nerve Agent (installed on HQ) • Medium (installed on R&D)

Not sure about the ICE break down...will need to play around with that a bit.

name: Take MSG
description: I'm trying MSG out of faction. Tyrant or Tsurugi or Komainu+MSG is ideal combo Sensei+Tsurugi is fun combo, too. Maybe -2 icewall and +1 ichi +1 Celeb Gift

name: Red Wings
description:
My Quetzal deck.

The idea is to build on Quetzal's obvious synergy with e3 Feedback Filters. Using Overmind, Knight, D4V1D, and your ability, you can get through pretty much anything. Cyberfeeders allow for more liberal use of Overmind, and allows you to install Cache for good returns. It's all tied in with Aesop's Pawnshop to sell all those used up Overmind, D4V1D, Daily Casts, and Caches. The Paper Tripping and Plascrete Carapace are obviously a meta-call, and Djinn, Mimic, and another Deja Vu should be considered for swap-ins.

Playing it, Overmind is very important, try not to use counters where you could use credits. Memory is also an issue, you'll be juggling around breakers and programs waiting to sell stuff on Aesop's, so if you're unfamiliar with the deck, you may run into issues just timing everything. The deck runs on a timer so wants to win quickly, options do dwindle rapidly as it goes on.
